title: [MINDSET] Ep. 181 How To Be Debt Free w/Paula Pant
description:
Get your own copy of Ashleyâ€™s new book You Turn at youturnbook.com!

Â 

How do you feel about spending versus saving money?

Â 

This is a very different week! Ash switches topics up and brings on Paula Pant, the host of the Afford Anything Podcast to talk all about how to be debt-free and financially free.

Â 

The topic of money can feel really uncomfortable to talk about, but Paulaâ€™s mantra you can afford anything, but not everything sparks a beautiful conversation around how to enjoy your relationship with money.

Â 

Have you taken the time to compare what you make, versus what you save? This gap is where the juicy opportunities for financial freedom lie. Paula and Ash talk through the various ways you can begin to grow the gap between these values and how to create consistency in your finances. And if you are an entrepreneur or small business owner unsure of how to pay yourself, here lies a path to create a stable and supportive income for yourself.Â 

Â 

Budgeting can feel restrictive and negative. But it doesnâ€™t have to be this way! In this episode, Paula talks through her anti-budget strategy, how to enjoy saving and spend and even plan for retirement. Paulaâ€™s view on finances is unique and doesnâ€™t make you feel as though you must restrict your money and your life.



In This Episode, We Discuss:

  1. 3 largest expenses we have, and how to make them more affordable.
  2. Grow the gap: what this means, and how to implement this idea into your financial health.
  3. Indicators of where your financial struggles lie.
  4. Budgeting advice that you can actually implement and enjoy following.
  5. How to talk with your partner about finances.

Â 

Where You Can Find Paula Pant:

Afford Anything Podcast

Â 

Resources:

Rich Dad Poor Dad by Robert Kiyosaki

Secrets of a Millionaire Mind by Harv Eker

Think and Grow Rich by Napoleon Hill

Mom and Dad, We Need to Talk by Cameron Huddleston

Millionaire Teacher by Andrew Hallam
